summary: Build a simple romantic pastel-themed interactive Valentine web page (React + TypeScript) that asks "Be my Valentine Richaa" with a dodging "No" option, a compulsory "Yes" path, and shows a generated meme plus supportive message after clicking Yes.
architectural_notes: Use React + TypeScript for implementation while keeping the UI as a single simple interactive page.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Square meme image with the caption “Good choice ❤️” in a cute romantic style (valentine-meme-good-choice.dim_1024x1024.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-screen romantic Valentine page in the React frontend that asks: “Be my Valentine Richaa” and presents two buttons: “Yes” and “No”.

Implement the “No” button as an evasive control: when the user’s pointer approaches/enters the “No” button area, the button moves to a new position so it cannot be clicked, effectively forcing the user to click “Yes”.

On clicking “Yes”, replace (or overlay) the question UI with a reveal state that shows: (1) a meme image containing the text “Good choice ❤️” and (2) the message “Promise I will always support u and protect u pondatiii ummmmaa”.

Apply a soft pastel romantic theme (pastel pink/white with complementary soft accents) consistently across the Valentine page, including background, typography, buttons, and spacing, using Tailwind CSS.
Add the generated meme image as a static frontend asset (do not serve it from the backend) and render it from the reveal view.

new_feature_requests.summary: Interactive Valentine page (pastel pink/white) asking "Be my Valentine Richaa" with Yes/No buttons
Make the "No" button evade the cursor on hover so it cannot be clicked (forcing Yes)
